intro: Spigelia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered spigelia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant features opposite, elliptic leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces clusters of small, tubular, red to orange flowers. Its flowers are typically arranged in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Spigelia pauciflora is adapted to moist, acidic soils and is often found in pine flatwoods and wetland habitats.
